description: A massive mechanical punching machine with a wall of burning boxing gloves. The machine can launch rapid-fire punches capable of defeating sea monsters. The '13' designation suggests Foxy created at least 12 previous versions, showing his dedication to trap and weapon preparation.
abilities: Gorilla Punch Golden Hits (enhanced power mode)

firstAppearance.context: Foxy unveils the Gorilla Puncher 13 in his ship's interior as part of his trap-filled combat arena, introducing it as one of his most powerful weapons.

significance: Demonstrates Foxy's reliance on prepared weapons and mechanical devices to supplement his Devil Fruit powers. The numbering suggests extensive preparation and iteration in designing trap mechanisms.

description: A special racket that Foxy uses to reflect and redirect his Noro Noro Beams off mirrors and reflective surfaces. This tool allows him to create complex beam patterns that bounce around enclosed spaces, making his Devil Fruit powers far more versatile.
abilities: Reflects Noro Noro Beams off mirrors
Key component of Noro Marble Oni Coach technique
Enables environmental manipulation of Devil Fruit powers

firstAppearance.context: Introduced in Foxy's mirror room as the key tool for creating his ultimate technique, the Noro Marble Oni Coach, which bounces slow beams in all directions.

significance: Represents Foxy's tactical approach to combat, using tools and preparation to maximize his Devil Fruit's effectiveness. Shows that even Devil Fruit users can benefit from specialized equipment.

description: Wooden decoy replicas of Foxy that he uses as part of his Foxy Shichihenge (Seven Transformations) technique. Combined with disguises and smoke, these create layers of deception to confuse opponents about which target is real.
abilities: Can be positioned throughout the battlefield
Effective when combined with smoke or limited visibility

firstAppearance.context: Foxy sets up fake wooden replicas of himself combined with disguises to confuse Luffy about which target is real during their combat.

significance: Another example of Foxy's preparation-based fighting style, using props and misdirection rather than relying solely on power or skill.

description: A large afro wig given to Luffy by Usopp before the Combat round. Usopp claimed it would make Luffy stronger, and Luffy continues to wear it throughout his battle with Foxy in this episode. The afro has become an iconic visual element of this arc.
abilities: Makes Luffy look more intimidating (according to Usopp)
Has become a legendary meme in the One Piece fandom

firstAppearance.context: Given to Luffy by Usopp before the Combat round begins, with Usopp insisting that afros make fighters stronger.

significance: Represents Luffy's willingness to do anything for his crew, even wearing silly costumes. The 'Afro Luffy' has become an iconic meme and fan-favorite visual from the series. Some fans theorize the wild hair foreshadows Luffy's eventual Gear 5 transformation.
currentStatus: Worn by Luffy during the Combat round
